title: Poisoned
data:
***Version [0.30](/0.30 "0.30")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

*This is about the [brand](/Brand "Brand"). For the status, see [Poison](/Poison "Poison").*

|   |                           |
| - | ------------------------- |
|   | It is coated with poison. |

**Poisoned** is a [brand](/Brand "Brand") that [darts](/Dart "Dart") may have. Such throwing weapons will usually poison any non-resistant [monsters](/Monster "Monster") they hit. Poisoning a target multiple times will strengthen the effect, causing it to deal more damage per turn and take longer to run its course.

## Strategy

- Poison is strong in the early Dungeon. One dart can kill most D:1 monsters. Multiple darts can soften all sorts of enemies before they get into melee. You don't need any Throwing skill to take advantage of them.
- Poison works very well with a [scroll of immolation](/Scroll_of_immolation "Scroll of immolation") (or [Inner Flame](/Inner_Flame "Inner Flame")). Every time poison damages a monster with Inner Flame, a [flame cloud](/Flame_cloud "Flame cloud") is created on the monster, greatly increasing the damage output. Plus, you'll get all the explosions at the end.

## History

- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") and [tomahawks](/Tomahawk "Tomahawk") could spawn with this brand.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), [The Shining One](/The_Shining_One "The Shining One") disapproved of the use of poisoned weapons.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), [arrows](/Arrow "Arrow"), [bolts](/Bolt "Bolt"), and [sling bullets](/Sling_bullet "Sling bullet") could have this brand.

| [Brands](/Brand "Brand") |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ------------------------ | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Melee weapons            | [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") • [Chaos](/Chaos "Chaos") • [Distortion](/Distortion "Distortion") • [Draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)") • [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") • [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") • [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") • [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy") • [Holy wrath](/Holy_wrath "Holy wrath") • [Pain](/Pain_\(brand\) "Pain (brand)") • [Protection](/Protection "Protection") • [Reaching](/Reaching "Reaching") • [Spectral](/Spectral_\(brand\) "Spectral (brand)") • [Speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)") • [Vampiric](/Vampiric "Vampiric") • [Venom](/Venom "Venom") [Disruption](/Disruption "Disruption") • [Dragon slaying](/Dragon_slaying "Dragon slaying") • [Reaping](/Reaping "Reaping") • [Silver](/Silver "Silver") |
| Launchers                | [Antimagic](/Antimagic "Antimagic") • [Draining](/Draining_\(brand\) "Draining (brand)") • [Electrocution](/Electrocution "Electrocution") • [Flaming](/Flaming "Flaming") • [Freezing](/Freezing "Freezing") • [Heavy](/Heavy "Heavy") • [Penetration](/Penetration "Penetration") • [Speed](/Speed_\(brand\) "Speed (brand)")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Throwing weapons         | [Atropa](/Atropa "Atropa") • [Curare](/Curare "Curare") • [Datura](/Datura "Datura") • [Dispersal](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)") • [Poisoned]() • [Silver](/Silver "Silver")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
html:
Poisoned

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.30: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.

This is about the brand. For the status, see Poison.

It is coated with poison.

Poisoned is a brand that darts may have. Such throwing weapons will usually poison any non-resistant monsters they hit. Poisoning a target multiple times will strengthen the effect, causing it to deal more damage per turn and take longer to run its course.

Strategy

  • Poison is strong in the early Dungeon. One dart can kill most D:1 monsters. Multiple darts can soften all sorts of enemies before they get into melee. You don't need any Throwing skill to take advantage of them.
  • Poison works very well with a scroll of immolation (or Inner Flame). Every time poison damages a monster with Inner Flame, a flame cloud is created on the monster, greatly increasing the damage output. Plus, you'll get all the explosions at the end.

History

  • Prior to 0.24, javelins and tomahawks could spawn with this brand.
  • Prior to 0.20, The Shining One disapproved of the use of poisoned weapons.
  • Prior to 0.18, arrows, bolts, and sling bullets could have this brand.
Brands
Melee weapons Antimagic • Chaos • Distortion • Draining • Electrocution • Flaming • Freezing • Heavy • Holy wrath • Pain • Protection • Reaching • Spectral • Speed • Vampiric • Venom
Disruption • Dragon slaying • Reaping • Silver
Launchers Antimagic • Draining • Electrocution • Flaming • Freezing • Heavy • Penetration • Speed
Throwing weapons Atropa • Curare • Datura • Dispersal • Poisoned • Silver

{{version030}}
''This is about the [[brand]]. For the status, see [[Poison]].''
{{flavour|It is coated with poison.}}

'''Poisoned''' is a [[brand]] that [[dart]]s may have. Such throwing weapons will usually poison any non-resistant [[monster]]s they hit. Poisoning a target multiple times will strengthen the effect, causing it to deal more damage per turn and take longer to run its course.

==Strategy==
*Poison is strong in the early Dungeon. One dart can kill most D:1 monsters. Multiple darts can soften all sorts of enemies before they get into melee. You don't need any Throwing skill to take advantage of them.
*Poison works very well with a [[scroll of immolation]] (or [[Inner Flame]]). Every time poison damages a monster with Inner Flame, a [[flame cloud]] is created on the monster, greatly increasing the damage output. Plus, you'll get all the explosions at the end.

==History==
*Prior to [[0.24]], [[javelin]]s and [[tomahawk]]s could spawn with this brand.
*Prior to [[0.20]], [[The Shining One]] disapproved of the use of poisoned weapons.
*Prior to [[0.18]], [[arrow]]s, [[bolt]]s, and [[sling bullet]]s could have this brand.
